perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Clause 12 - INVOICING AND PAYMENT TERMS       (i) Clause 12.1(ii) of the GMA shall be cancelled and substituted as follow:   [*****] All invoices shall be paid within 60 days of receipt. [*****]     [*****]     [*****]     [*****]     [*****]     [*****]     [*****]     (ii) Any other provision of Clause 12 shall remain in full force and effect. Notwithstanding the foregoing, all undisputed invoices are due within 30 days of receipt. Late payments shall accrue interest at a rate of 1.5% per month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding payment deadlines. Clause 12.1(ii) states invoices shall be paid within 60 days, while the added sentence mandates payment within 30 days and imposes late fees. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline and penalty for late payment.

perturbation.changed_text: 5.2.1 Subject to sub-Clause 5.2.5 below and in the event the Representatives (i) fail to create such committee or (ii) do not agree on an amicable settlement within [*****] from the date the committee referred to in this sub-Clause 5.2 has been created or such longer period as may be agreed upon in writing by the Representatives (the "Amicable Settlement Period"), the Dispute shall be exclusively and finally settled under the Rules and Conciliation of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce (the "ICC") by an arbitral tribunal composed of three (3) arbitrators; each Party shall then appoint one (1) arbitrator within [*****]from the last day of the Amicable Settlement Period and the third arbitrator, who will act as President, will be appointed by the other two (2) arbitrators. In case the two (2) arbitrators appointed by the Parties do not agree on this choice with [*****] from the date the last arbitrator is appointed, the third arbitrator will be appointed by the ICC Court. However, either party may elect to pursue litigation in the courts of New York instead of arbitration, regardless of any other provision in this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The change introduces a direct contradiction regarding the dispute resolution mechanism. The original clause mandates exclusive arbitration under ICC rules. The added sentence allows either party to pursue litigation, overriding the arbitration requirement. This creates uncertainty and legal ambiguity regarding how disputes will be resolved.

perturbation.original_text: 4.6 This Clause 4 shall survive termination or expiry of this Amendment for a period of five (5) years following such End Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.6 This Clause 4 shall survive termination or expiry of this Amendment for a period of five (5) years following such End Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the obligations in Section 4.1 related to trade secrets shall survive indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict concerning the survival period of confidentiality obligations. While the main clause specifies a five-year survival for Clause 4, the added sentence stipulates that obligations related to trade secrets within Section 4.1 survive indefinitely. It creates ambiguity regarding whether only trade secret obligations survive indefinitely or all obligations within Section 4.1.
